Building module¶

The Building module is used to calculate the heating and cooling demand of a building. It is separated into the following sub-packages.

Geometry¶

The geometry module is used to create and manipulate the geometry of a building. Output should consist of all opaque and transparent areas, their types (roof, outside_wall, window) and their orientations.

class building.geometry.Geometry(width, length, story_height, stories, roof_type)¶

Bases: object

rotate_building()¶
building.geometry.floorplane_from_geopolygone(polygone)¶

Calculate the area of a geopolygone.

Location¶

building.location.conv_zip_to_location(zip)¶

Convert postcode (zip) into information about the location. If no information can be found returns None. Otherwise dict with city, latitude and longitude will be returned.

building.location.read_location_data()¶

load the location data from a csv file.

building.location.save_location_data(location)¶

save the location dictionary as csv file in the building models data directory.

Physics¶

building.physics.energyBalance(gains=[], losses=[])¶

Calculate the energy balance.

\[Q = \sum{Q_{loss} - \sum{Q_{gain}}}\]
Parameters

  • gains (list (float)) – All heat gains of the building. [Wh]

  • losses (list (float)) – All heat losses of the building. [Wh]

Returns

Heating (+)/Cooling (-) demand. [Wh]

Return type

float

building.physics.infAndVent(n, volume, tempIn, tempAmb)¶

Calculate the infiltration and/or ventilation losses of a volume.

\[\dot{Q} = n \cdot V \cdot\]

ho cdot c_{P,air} cdot (T_{in} - T_{amb})

param n

Ventilation/Infiltration rate \(n\) [1/h]

type n

float

param volume

Volume of the construction element \(V\) [m^3]

type volume

float

param tempIn

Temperature inside of the volume :math: T_{in} [°C]

type tempIn

float

param tempAmb

Temperature outside of the volume :math: T_{amb} [°C]

type tempAmb

float

return

Heatflow through the construction element :math: dot{Q} [W]

rtype

float

building.physics.solarGains(gValue, area, irrad)¶

Calculate the solar gains through a transparent construction element.

\[\{Q} = g \cdot A \cdot G_{n}\]
Parameters

  • gValue (float) – Solar heat gain coefficient \(g\) [-]

  • area (float) – Area of the construction element \(A\) [m^2]

  • irrad (float) – irradiation perpendicular to the construction element :math: G_{n} [W/m^2]

Returns

Heatflow through the construction element :math: dot{Q} [W]

Return type

float

building.physics.transmission(uValue, area, tempIn, tempAmb)¶

Calculate the transmission losses through a construction element.

\[\{Q} = U \cdot A \cdot (T_{in} - T_{amb})\]
Parameters

  • uValue (float) – Heat transfer coefficient \(U\) [W/m^2K]

  • area (float) – Area of the construction element \(A\) [m^2]

  • tempIn (float) – Temperature inside of the const. element :math: T_{in} [°C]

  • tempAmb (float) – Temperature outside of the const. element :math: T_{amb} [°C]

Returns

Heatflow through the construction element :math: dot{Q} [W]

Return type

float
